message:
Hello guys, 

// I am not 100% sure if what I am asking is a valid question or not.

Anybody here knows some good resources to give the sense of the maximum 'requests per seconds' for the most common technologies.

// More just to explain what I mean.
For example what will be the bottleneck for ROR deployed with unicorn on a server managed by Nginx, how can I estimate the max Requests per second for each?

I know there is lots into this topic, lots of OS included, networks and more. If you got any helpful resource please share.

Thank you.

data.message:
I think you should stress test your app 
Write an integration test to do that

I guess this can help, it calculates benchmarks for different frameworks combinations. and it's really awesome. but I guess you should also test you own design and configuration.
https://www.techempower.com/benchmarks/#section=data-r13&hw=ph&test=update

You could use apache jmeter to do load tests then you have an idea how much your whole system can handle, also while doing that you could log how much time of it did the database take and how much did the other layers take, just to know where the bottleneck is, if any
U can get the throughput, std dev and a lot more from jmeter http://jmeter.apache.org/
